results.title: Introduction to optics
results.creator_credit: Norton Bloom and Educational Services Incorporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”.
Elbert P. Little discusses the approximation that light travels in a straight line and demonstrates how its direction is changed by diffraction, scattering, refraction and reflection. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Universal gravitation
results.creator_credit: Jack Churchill, Kevin Smith and Educational Services, Inc.
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”
Defines the law of universal gravitation by visualising a solar system of one star and one planet. Demonstrates the kinematics and dynamics of planetary motion. Uses a digital computer to display satellite orbits.
Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Public enemy no. 1
results.creator_credit: Fred S Nieman and National Women's Christian Temperance Union
results.brief_description: A moral guidance docudrama delivering a strong message about the evils of alcohol. A teenager fails a sobriety test after the police pull him over for erratic driving. He avoids arrest when the police decide to release him into the care of his physician father. Concerned by his son’s behaviour, the father organises a weekend in the country to impart his views about the dangers of alcohol. Throughout the weekend, dad discusses how alcoholic beverages are made, advertised and sold and their damaging effect on mind and body. Despite its intention, the film’s moral tone and wholesome setting would force most teenagers to resort to alcohol.

results.title: Properties of matter
results.creator_credit: Tarquin Cardona, Bob Starner, Olga Palacio, First Light Pictures and Schlessinger Media
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Physical science in action”.
Matter is anything and everything that takes up space. This program investigates the different properties of matter - mass, weight, volume and density, as well as the four phases of matter - solid, liquid, gas and plasma. Also introduced is the idea of chemical properties to further help describe and understand the world we live in. Suitable for Upper primary/lower secondary students. Teachers notes included.

results.title: Energy and work
results.creator_credit: Quentin Brown and Educational Services Incorporated
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”.
Part of the “Physical science study committee series” presents experimental evidence that the work done on a body, measured as the area under the force-distance curve, is a measure of the transfer of kinetic energy to the body calculated from its mass and velocity. Dorothy Montgomery demonstrates the relationships using mechanical devices.

Dorothy Montgomery demonstrates the relationships using mechanical devices.

results.title: The Rutherford atom
results.creator_credit: Quentin Brown, Kevin Smith, Educational Services Incorporated and Physical Sciences Study Committee
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”.
A cloud chamber and gold foil in a simple alpha-particle scattering experiment illustrates the historic Rutherford experiment which led to the nuclear model of the atom. Behaviour of alpha particles clarified by use of large scale models illustrating the nuclear atom and Coulomb scattering.

results.title: Forces
results.creator_credit: Tarquin Cardona, Bob Starner, Olga Palacio, First Light Pictures and Schlessinger Media
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Physical science in action”.
There are many forces at work shaping our world every moment of our lives. This video describes Newton’s laws (first, second and third), friction, gravity, air and water pressure, and electromagnetism. Also explored is the concept of unbalanced forces. Suitable for Upper primary/lower secondary students. Teachers notes included.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tarquin Cardona, Bob Starner, Olga Palacio, First Light Pictures and Schlessinger Media

results.title: The Interference of photons
results.creator_credit: Educational Services Incorporated and Physical Sciences Study Committee
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”.
Presents an experiment at MIT in which light exhibits both particle and wave characteristics. Characteristic interference pattern is pointed out by many individual photons hitting at places consistent with the interference pattern.

results.title: Sound waves in air
results.creator_credit: Quentin Brown, Kevin Smith and Educational Services, Inc.
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”.
Investigates wave characteristics of sound transmission with large-scale equipment, using frequencies up to 5000 cycles. Experiments in reflection, diffraction, interference and refraction are supplemented by ripple-tank analogies. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Quentin Brown, Kevin Smith and Educational Services, Inc.

results.title: The Millikan experiment
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”.
Simplified experiment substituting standard spheres for oil drops; analysis of the charge related to the velocity of the sphere across field of view of microscope emphasises the evidence that charge comes in natural units that are all alike; numerous changes of charge are shown, produced by X-rays.
results.description:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”.
